intro: Helianthemum cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its fleshy, evergreen leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is often found in open habitats such as cliffs, slopes, and scrublands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Cistaceae family.
